text: FLYONE is a privately owned low-cost airline headquartered in Chișinău, Moldova. It was founded in 2015 and formally launched operations in 2016. It operates scheduled and charter flights from its base at Chișinău International Airport. == History == The airline received its Air Operator Certificate in late March 2016, and operated its first scheduled passenger flights in June 2016 to Antalya, Heraklion, and Rhodes. In 2019, FlyOne, launched a platform for travel planning in collaboration with GoQuo. == Destinations == FlyOne currently operates direct flights to the following destinations: {|class="sortable wikitable" |- !Country !City !Airport !Notes !Refs |- |Egypt||Sharm El Sheikh||Sharm El Sheikh International Airport|||| align="center" | |- |France||Paris||Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport|| align="center"| || align="center" | |- |Germany||Lautzenhausen||Frankfurt–Hahn Airport || || align="center"| |- |Greece||Heraklion||Heraklion International Airport|||| align="center" | |- |Ireland||Dublin||Dublin Airport||||align=center| |- |Israel||Tel Aviv||Ben Gurion Airport||||align=center| |- |Italy||Parma||Parma Airport||||align=center| |- |Italy||Verona||Verona Villafranca Airport||||align=center| |- |Moldova||Chișinău||Chișinău International Airport||||align=center| |- |Portugal||Lisbon||Lisbon Airport|||| align="center" | |- |Russia||Moscow||Vnukovo International Airport || align="center"| || align="center" | |- |Russia||Saint Petersburg||Pulkovo Airport || align="center"| || align="center" | |- |Turkey||Antalya||Antalya Airport||||align=center| |- |Turkey||Bodrum||Milas–Bodrum Airport|||| |- |Turkey||Izmir||Adnan Menderes Airport|||| align="center" | |- |United Kingdom||London||London Southend Airport|||| align="center" | |- |} ===Codeshare agreements=== FlyOne has a codeshare agreement with Utair. ==Fleet== Airbus A320-200 As of September 2019, the FlyOne fleet includes the following aircraft: {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em auto; text- align:center" |+ FLYONE fleet |- !Aircraft !In service !Orders !Passengers !Notes |- |Airbus A319-100 |1 |-- |138 | |- |Airbus A320-200 |4 |-- |180 | |- !Total !5 !-- ! colspan="4" | |} == References == ==External links== *Official website Category:Airlines established in 2016 Category:Airlines of Moldova Category:Moldovan brands Category:2016 establishments in Moldova Category:Low- cost carriers
